text:
**Timing and Momentum**: The MLC's second season is set to start on July 5, just six days after the T20 men's cricket World Cup final, which could help capitalize on the momentum of the US team's recent success.

**Background**: Cricket is the second-most-watched sport in the world, but previous attempts to establish a professional league in the US have failed. MLC debuted in July 2023 with six teams competing in the T20 format, featuring top players from around the world.

**Season 1**: The first season of MLC outperformed expectations, with sold-out games in Morrisville, NC, and high attendance in Grand Prairie, TX. The league received positive feedback from players and fans alike.

**Challenges and Goals**: The league's biggest challenge is building infrastructure, including permanent venues in each city. The goal is to create a more casual presence in American sports fans' lives and eventually secure more lucrative broadcast deals.

**Expansion and Growth**: MLC is planning to expand to new cities, including Atlanta, Chicago, Toronto, New Jersey, and South Florida, with the aim of adding two new teams by 2026. The league is also developing a minor league to cultivate young domestic talent and plans to increase community outreach and engagement.

**Broadcast and Partnerships**: MLC games will be broadcast in more than 80 countries, and the league is negotiating partnerships with regional sports networks in its six cities. Select games will air on CBS Sports Network.

**US National Teams**: The success of the US men's national team, including their upset win over Pakistan, has helped drive more attention to the sport. MLC's director believes this will open up better broadcast opportunities for the league.

* Andre Russell hit a 107m six, the longest of MLC season two, while playing for Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) against San Francisco Unicorns.
* Russell scored an unbeaten 40 off 25 balls to help LAKR reach a total of 165/6, but they were unable to defend it.
* LAKR now has one win and two defeats after three games, having finished at the bottom of the table in the previous season.
* LAKR's next match is against San Francisco Unicorns again, on Sunday, July 14.

The second season of the Major League Cricket (MLC) began on July 4th, 2024, with the league gaining List-A status from the International Cricket Council, increasing its global significance. As of now, the standings show Washington Freedom and San Francisco Unicorns at the top with 1 win and 0 losses each, with San Francisco Unicorns having a higher net run rate. The teams closely behind are MI New York, Los Angeles Knight Riders, and Seattle Orcas, while Texas Super Kings are at the bottom with 0 wins and 2 losses. The league's growth is promising with significant investments driving it forward.

**Match Result:** Seattle Orcas won their first match of the tournament, defeating La Knight Riders by 9 wickets.

**Key Performances:**

* Ryan Rickelton of Seattle Orcas scored 103 off 66 balls, including 5 sixes, to lead his team's chase.
* Jason Roy of La Knight Riders top-scored with 69 off 52 balls.
* David Miller of La Knight Riders scored 44 off 22 balls, including 2 sixes.

**Tournament Standings:** The league table is currently tight, with five out of six teams having registered a win. The Texas Super Kings are the only team without a point.

**Notable Mentions:**

* Seattle Orcas restricted La Knight Riders to 168/5 in their 20 overs, thanks to a strong bowling performance by Cameron Gannon, Zaman Khan, and Imad Wasim.
* The La Knight Riders' top-class batting lineup, including David Miller and Andre Russell, was unable to overcome the Orcas' bowling attack.

* Texas Super Kings (TSK) fast bowler Gerald Coetzee has been ruled out of MLC 2024 due to a low-grade left side strain suffered during a game against Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR).
* Coetzee finished with figures of 1/28 in the affected game, and a replacement is yet to be named.
* Veteran all-rounder Dwayne Bravo has replaced Coetzee in the XI for the upcoming game against Washington Freedom.

* The Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 season has started from July 6th.
* The Los Angeles Knight Riders is one of the teams participating in the tournament.
* Crickex is the principal sponsor of the Los Angeles Knight Riders team in the MLC 2024 season.

* In a previous match, Faf du Plessis scored a century, but the Texas Super Kings vs Washington Freedom match was washed out.

**Match Details:** The Seattle Orcas will take on the LA Knight Riders in the MLC 2024 tournament on Wednesday, July 10, at the Grand Prairie Stadium in Dallas. The match will start at 6:00 AM IST (Indian Standard Time).

**Broadcasting Details:** The match will be broadcast live on Sony Sports Ten 5 TV channel in India, and fans can also stream the match online for free on the JioCinema app.

**Recent Match Update:** In a recent match, Faf du Plessis scored a century, but it ended in vain as the Texas Super Kings vs Washington Freedom match was washed out.

* The Texas Super Kings won their first match in the 2024 Major League Cricket season, defeating the San Francisco Unicorns by 7 wickets at Church Street Park in Morrisville.
* The Unicorns set a target of 127 runs, which the Super Kings chased down comfortably thanks to opening partnership between Faf du Plessis (34 off 17) and Devon Conway (32 off 19).
* Aaron Hardie's 34 off 23 balls ensured the Super Kings reached the target despite Conway's retirement due to injury.
* The Unicorns struggled with their batting, losing momentum after a strong powerplay, with only Matt Short scoring a notable 33.
* Mohammad Mohsin was the star performer for the Super Kings, taking 4 wickets for just 13 runs with a disciplined bowling spell.

**Match Result:** Seattle Orcas (SOR) defeated Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) by 9 wickets in the sixth match of MLC 2024 on July 10.

**Match Highlights:**

* Ryan Rickelton scored an unbeaten 103 runs off 66 balls, while Quinton de Kock scored a half-century, helping Seattle chase the target of 168-5 set by Los Angeles.
* Jason Roy and David Miller powered LAKR to 168-5 in 20 overs.

**Tournament Details:**

* The 2024 Cognizant Major League Cricket (MLC) season will take place from July 6 to July 29 (July 5 to July 28 in the USA).
* The tournament will feature 25 matches.
* The tournament is in its second season.

**Broadcasting Rights:**

* Prime Video has secured exclusive broadcast rights for the 2024 MLC season in Australia and New Zealand.
* All 25 matches will be available on Prime Video at no extra cost to a Prime or Prime Video membership.

**Teams and Players:**

* The tournament will feature six teams from major cities in the USA: Dallas, San Francisco, New York City, Seattle, Los Angeles, and Washington D.C.
* The teams will consist of international T20 superstars and top domestic players from the USA, Australia, and New Zealand.
* Notable players include Pat Cummins, Steve Smith, Glenn Maxwell, Travis Head, Ricky Ponting, Tim David, and Trent Boult, among others.

**Availability:**

* Prime members in Australia and Prime Video customers in New Zealand can watch all live MLC matches on their Prime Video app on various devices, including smart TVs, mobile devices, Fire TV, and more.
* Matches can be downloaded for offline viewing at no additional cost.

* The article mentions an incident from the Major League Cricket 2024 tournament.
* Mitchell Santner, playing for the Texas Super Kings, hit a 106m six off a delivery by San Francisco Orcas' left-arm spinner Hassan Khan.
* The six was hit towards the leg side on the sixth ball of the 12th over.

* The Texas Super Kings won their first match of the MLC 2024 season, defeating the San Francisco Unicorns by 7 wickets at Church Street Park in Morrisville.
* The Super Kings bowled first and restricted the Unicorns to 127 in 17.5 overs, thanks to Mohammad Mohsin's 4/13 and Dwayne Bravo's 2/20.
* The Super Kings chased the target clinically, with openers Faf du Plessis (34 off 17) and Devon Conway (32 off 19) setting the tone, and Aaron Hardie (34 off 23) guiding them to the target in 12.5 overs.
* With this win, the Super Kings jumped to the top of the points table with 3 points from 3 games, while the Unicorns slipped to 5th place with 2 points from 2 games.

**Match Result:** Seattle Orcas won against Los Angeles Knight Riders.

**Player of the Match:** Ryan Rickelton for his scintillating knock of 103 runs in 66 deliveries.

**Key Performances:**

* Ryan Rickelton: 103 runs in 66 deliveries, maiden T20 century
* Quinton de Kock: 50+ runs, partnered with Ryan Rickelton for a 152-run stand
* David Miller: Helped Los Angeles Knight Riders end their innings at 168 runs

**Post-Match Quotes:**

* Ryan Rickelton: Happy to contribute to the team, credits Quinton de Kock for their partnership
* Heinrich Klaasen (Seattle Orcas captain): Credits Quinton de Kock and Ryan Rickelton for their partnership, praises local players and overseas players
* Sunil Narine (Los Angeles Knight Riders captain): Feels they played a good game, need to adapt and bounce back strongly

* Gerald Coetzee, a 23-year-old fast bowler, was playing for the Texas Super Kings in the Major League Cricket.
* On July 5, Coetzee sustained a low-grade left abdominal strain during a match against the LA Knight Riders.
* As a result, he was released by the Texas Super Kings due to the injury.
* Coetzee will return to South Africa for further medical attention and assessment by Cricket South Africa's medical team.

* Gerald Coetzee, a 23-year-old fast bowler, was playing for the Texas Super Kings in the Major League Cricket tournament.
* On July 5, Coetzee sustained a low-grade left abdominal strain during a fixture against the LA Knight Riders.
* As a result, Coetzee was released by the Texas Super Kings due to his injury.
* He will undergo further medical assessments by Cricket South Africa's medical team upon his return home.

The Texas Super Kings won their first match of the 2024 MLC season, defeating the San Francisco Unicorns by 7 wickets at Church Street Park in Morrisville. The Unicorns set a target of 127, but the Super Kings' openers, Faf du Plessis and Devon Conway, made quick work of the chase. Conway scored 32 off 19 before retiring hurt, while du Plessis scored 34 off 17. Aaron Hardie took over, scoring 34 off 23 to seal the win. The Unicorns' top scorer was Matt Short with 33, but they struggled against the Super Kings' bowling, particularly Mohammad Mohsin who took 4/13.

* Ryan ten Doeschate, a former Netherlands all-rounder, is part of the supporting staff of KKR's subsidiaries in the Caribbean Premier League, Major League Cricket, and ILT20.

In the MLC 2024 tournament, Mitchell Santner of the Texas Super Kings hit a massive 106-meter six against San Francisco Unicorns at Church Street Park. Santner, a Kiwi all-rounder, achieved this feat in the 12th over of the innings while chasing a target of 128. The six was hit off Pakistani spinner Hassan Khan's delivery. Santner's team was in a strong position to win, thanks to a good start provided by Devon Conway and Faf du Plessis.

In the 2024 Major League Cricket season, the Texas Super Kings secured their first victory by defeating the San Francisco Unicorns by 7 wickets at Church Street Park in Morrisville. The Super Kings chased down a target of 127, thanks to contributions from Faf du Plessis (34 off 17), Devon Conway (32 off 19), and Aaron Hardie (34 off 23). The Unicorns were restricted to 127 due to consistent wickets, with Matt Short scoring 33. Mohammad Mohsin was the standout performer, taking 4 wickets for 13 runs and playing a crucial role in the Super Kings' victory.

The match will be played at a batter-friendly venue, with short boundaries and a consistent bounce that favours strokeplay. * The Major League Cricket (MLC) 2024 season has started on July 6th.
* Crickex, an online sports exchange platform, is the principal sponsor of the Los Angeles Knight Riders team in the MLC.
* The partnership aims to enhance the fan experience and contribute to the growth of Major League Cricket.
* This is Crickex's first major partnership with an American cricket team.

* The Los Angeles Knight Riders (LAKR) played against the San Francisco Unicorns in the MLC tournament.
* Andre Russell, representing LAKR, hit a 107-meter six, the longest six of MLC season two, in the final over of the match.
* Russell scored an unbeaten 40 off 25 balls, including the six, but LAKR still lost the match, managing a total of 165/6.
* San Francisco Unicorns chased down the target in 15.2 overs, leaving LAKR with one win and two defeats after three games.
* LAKR will face San Francisco Unicorns again on Sunday, July 14, and Russell will look to redeem his team and secure an important win.

* The tournament is called Major League Cricket 2024.
* The teams participating in the tournament include:
	+ Los Angeles Knight Riders
	+ Seattle Orcas
	+ San Francisco Unicorns
	+ Texas Super Kings
* The following matches have been played:
	+ 2nd Match: Texas Super Kings vs Los Angeles Knight Riders
	+ 4th Match: San Francisco Unicorns vs Los Angeles Knight Riders
	+ 6th Match: Los Angeles Knight Riders vs Seattle Orcas
	+ 7th Match: San Francisco Unicorns vs Texas Super Kings

No further information about the results, scores, or player performances is provided in the given text.

**Match Preview**: The 7th match of the Major League Cricket tournament will be played between San Francisco Unicorns and Texas Super Kings. San Francisco Unicorns are in good form, having won their last match, while Texas Super Kings are struggling with their bowling performance.

**Match Details**:

* Match 7: San Francisco Unicorns vs Texas Super Kings
* Venue: Church Street Park, Morrisville
* Pitch Report: Batting friendly pitch, with an average first innings score of 155. Chasing teams have won 8 out of 10 matches played on this ground.

**Match Details**

* The 1st match of the 2024 Major League Cricket season is between MI New York and Seattle Orcas.
* The match is being played at Church Street Park, Morrisville, a batting-friendly pitch where chasing has been very easy.

**Teams**

* MI New York, led by Nicholas Pooran, are the title defenders and have a well-balanced squad with a lethal bowling attack featuring Trent Boult, Kagiso Rabada, and Anrich Nortje, as well as a strong batting lineup with big hitters like Nicholas Pooran, Kieron Pollard, Tim David, and Dwarld Brevis.
* Seattle Orcas, led by Heinrich Klassen, have a strong batting core comprising Ryan Rickelton, Quinton de Kock, and Heinrich Klaasen, as well as all-rounders Aaron Jones, Michael Bracewell, and Imad Wasim, and a formidable bowling attack featuring Nandre Burger, Wayne Parnell, Obed McCoy, and Zaman Khan.

**Match Details**: The 8th match of the 2024 Major League Cricket tournament will be played between Seattle Orcas and Washington Freedom at the Grand Prairie Stadium, Dallas on Friday, 12th July 2024, at 20:30 local time.

**Pitch Report**: The pitch at the Grand Prairie Stadium is expected to be good for batting, with scores of 160-170 expected for teams batting first. The wicket may offer some turn for spinners, but pace bowlers can also find success.

**Team Previews**:

* **Seattle Orcas**: After losing their opening game, the Orcas bounced back with a win over Los Angeles in Match 6. They will rely on their powerful South African contingent at the top of the order, including Ryan Rickelton and Quinton de Kock. Their bowling attack, led by Cameron Gannon, will aim to build on their recent success.
* **Washington Freedom**: Despite rain interruptions in their first two matches, Washington Freedom have emerged with one win and one no-result. They boast two in-form Australian openers, Travis Head and Steve Smith, who have been hitting runs at a strike-rate of 200+. Their bowling attack, featuring Lockie Ferguson, Glenn Maxwell, and Saurabh Netravalkar, has excellent depth and variety.

**Predicted Playing 11**:

* Seattle Orcas: Ryan Rickelton, Nauman Anwar, Quinton de Kock (wk), Shubham Ranjane, Heinrich Klaasen (c), Imad Wasim, Hamad Azam, Harmeet Singh, Nandre Burger, Zaman Khan, Cameron Gannon
* Washington Freedom: Travis Head, Steve Smith (c), Saurabh Netravalkar, Andrie Gous (wk), Glenn Maxwell, Obus Pienaar, Mukhtar Ahmed, Marco Jansen, Lockie Ferguson, Justin Dill, Akeal Hosein
